intro: Romulea quartzicola, commonly known as the quartz rock orchid, is a perennial flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often with a distinctive black or purple pattern. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
